embeds.title: :pick: Prison Mining console not working :pick:
embeds.description:
The Prison area especially is known for its bugs, and the mining terminals may not work properly. It may occasionally work on brand new servers. Changing Regions in order to ensure a different server can help if you decide to server hop.

Otherwise, there are 3 options for getting out of prison:

**1.** Check your mission manager for the 'Fix 02 Kiosk', complete for merits

**2.** Escape (you will need a buddy to pick you up)

**3.** Wait it out (online or offline works)

embeds.title: :key: Fan code doesn't work / Rover pod won't open :key:
embeds.description:
There is a bug within the prison system that the escape route and vehicle storage **cannot be used multiple times**. __Once used by another player, they have a very high chance to be broken/bugged__, the only fix is a server reset.

We recommend **server hopping** until you find one where it works, changing server region helps avoid being placed in the same server again.

embeds.title: :tools: Mining tool stuck on hand :tools:
embeds.description:
While in prison, your inventory is temporarily removed and set to a prison loadout, but can easily glitch out when __dying/spawning repeatedly__ in the mines.

**Remove all Medpens, Oxypens and Multi-tools** from your loadout, and only keep the prison suit and helmet. If there's still something in your hand, drop it in the mines, if you can **find an oxypen or shank on the floor**, try to pick it up and then drop it, then hold backspace to respawn. 

Otherwise exit to main menu and join the PU again. __Repeat until fixed__.

embeds.title: :potato: Game is unplayable on Low settings :potato:
embeds.description:
In-game frame rates have a performance limit due to a few factors: 

**1.** The game client isn't heavily optimized yet and __no matter how good your PC hardware is, it will hit that ceiling__ until the game's engine/code is better optimized later in development.

 **2.** Any in-game event with its extra renderings will tank FPS no matter what.
Even without events, in general, don't expect more than **__10-15__ in major planetary cities/spaceports. __20-30__ in space, and maybe __40-60__ if you're lucky in deep space.**

```Guide to slightly better performance```
> Set your game resolution to your monitor's native. 
> Fullscreen works best on most PCs. 
> Turn off Chromatic Abberation, Film Grain and Motion Blur. 
> Change Volumetric Cloud Detail to medium.
> Vsync OFF unless you're playing on a TV or Ultrawide monitor. 
> Graphics quality preset to Medium if your CPU is better, or High if your GPU is better.
> 
>  The game is very **CPU/RAM intensive** and the __lower the graphics, the more load it places on your processor__. Setting the graphics to high or very high shares much of the load between the CPU and GPU.

For NVIDIA GPU users: [double check](https://www.howtogeek.com/175281/how-to-force-graphics-options-in-pc-games-with-nvidia-amd-or-intel-graphics) that the game is using your __graphics card__ and not your CPU as the GPU. That issue normally only applies to **laptops**, but there are a handful of desktop motherboards that have that issue as well.

```Force StarCitizen to use nVidia GPU```
* Open the NVIDIA Control Panel
* Click "Manage 3D Settings"
* Click the "Program Settings" tab
* Add the StarCitizen.exe file located by default in C:\Program Files\Roberts Space Industries\StarCitizen\LIVE\Bin64\
* Select "High-performance NVIDIA processor" from the preferred graphics processor drop-down list

If you don't see that dropdown list, then you don't have that issue

Other optimization settings:
For AMD graphics cards: https://youtu.be/K1N4vV5BSoI

For NVIDIA graphics cards: https://youtu.be/jZrnfWpENTo

embeds.title: :heavy_multiplication_x: XenoThreat event cargo :heavy_multiplication_x:
embeds.description:
This char explains the XenoThreat event cargo types.
You can feasibly load all 3 types of cargo, __**if**__ you have: 

**1.** Multiple helpers

**2.** A ship as fast or faster than an MSR

**3.** Only load up from 1 wreck before hitting max thrusters and heading straight to Jericho.

embeds.title: :keyboard: Controls / Keybinds not working :keyboard:
embeds.description:
The usual causes are:

**1.** Keybinding **profile is corrupted** after a patch (which changed the keybinds)

**2.** Accidentally **pressing SHIFT+TAB** and activating cursor mode, which disables all other inputs

**3.** Accidentally **pressing RIGHT SHIFT**, which locks the mouse aim while flying

**4.** Having a **gamepad or joystick** tipped over or otherwise sending inputs. (Can also cause cursor to appear or disappear unexpectedly)

Solution: [Save your keybinds[(https://support.robertsspaceindustries.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000183328-Create-export-and-import-custom-profiles) before anything bad happens, so you always have a backup ready to go.

After saving the keybinds, **copy the file** from __USER\Client\0\Controls\Mappings__ and then **delete the User folder**
**Run the RSI Launcher** and start the game, and the file will automatically be recreated
**Paste the copied file** back into the folder and load the settings from in-game

__Note:__ If CIG changes the keybinds according to the patch notes, you will need to redo your keys and create a new save file. (rarely happens)
